June 16, 2013, William was a client of Michael’s

As an entertainer/musician Michael Powers is the standard by which all other service providers is measured by.  I've known Michael since 1990, been to many shows and concerts, booked him a few times and have always enjoyed the spirit, technique, and unique perspective he brings to music and its interpretation to the listener. Any event planner worth their fee, will be lucky to find an open date to bring in Michael Powers to perform, from elegant to eclectic, your event will be remembered for the music.

Robert "Rob" Greves
CEO Dowknowhow.com
August 9, 2008, Robert "Rob" worked with Michael but at different companies

Michael may not realize it but from an outsiders point of view, he's living the dream. However, I think he does realize it and that is why he's always smiling. Regardless of whether your talking to Michael or listening to his music, I can truly say you will ALWAYS learn something. Something in the way he presents himself will make you change the way you confront your world in an attempt to be a better individual. Michael is a mentor without knowing it; a teacher without teaching and a true inspiration to all who are willing to stop for a moment and listen to his message. He is a first class full-on powerhouse guitarist, singer and composer and if you are ever fortunate enough to slow Michael down long enough to sit and talk with him, do it... If you can't... then just listen carefully to his message.

summary: Michael was born in New York City, but grew up in the San Francisco Bay area. His musical career began as therapy, when at the age of 15 he took up strumming the guitar to strengthen his wrist after a skateboard accident. Following his graduation from Berkeley High School when he was 15½, he moved to Seattle and frequented local jam sessions, keeping his fingers on the guitar strings and his mind on making his music reach a wider audience. Says Powers, I learned how to play by sitting in at as many places as I could, developing eclectic tastes by playing with all types of bands: Jazz, Rock, Blues, R&B, and Top 40. I wanted to learn how to play any kind of music that featured a guitar as a solo voice. His style was also influenced by a diverse group of musicians which includes Jimi Hendrix, Carlos Santana, Charlie Parker, George Benson, Stanley Jordan, Miles Davis, and Kevin Eubanks. On stage, Michael has shared billings with piano giant Herbie Hancock, classic Jazz saxophonist Eddie Clean Head Vinson, the legendary Ray Charles, Afro-pop star King Sunny Ade, Grammy award-winning vocalist Diane Schuur, R&B greats Gladys Knight and the Pips and Atlantic Starr, contemporary Jazz artists Ronny Jordan, Tom Grant, David Benoit, the Yellowjackets, and the duo of Tuck & Patti. Its hard to categorize my music, although it usually ends up in the Jazz record bins, says Michael. If I had to put a label on it, I would call it contemporary instrumental music. Its a sound rooted in the Jazz tradition that keeps pace stylistically with Pop, R&B, and Blues; with Blues being at the core of my inspiration. His powerful performances have regularly commanded standing ovations."​"Michael Powers' music seamlessly and simultaneously honors the past, celebrates the present, and fearlessly reaches into thefuture!Specialties: Provider of superb entertainment for all types of venues and groups.
name: Michael Powers
